mo.md("""
## Try Your Own Query

Write SQL directly against the semantic layer:
""")
query_input%20%3D%20mo.ui.text_area(%0A%20%20%20%20value%3D%22SELECT%20revenue%2C%20status%20FROM%20orders%20WHERE%20status%20%3D%20'completed'%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20label%3D%22SQL%20Query%22%0A)%0A%0Aquery_input %23%20Execute%20custom%20query%0Atry%3A%0A%20%20%20%20custom_result%20%3D%20layer.sql(query_input.value)%0A%20%20%20%20custom_df%20%3D%20custom_result.fetchdf()%0A%0A%20%20%20%20mo.ui.table(custom_df)%0Aexcept%20Exception%20as%20e%3A%0A%20%20%20%20mo.md(f%22**Error%3A**%20%7Bstr(e)%7D%22)

What Just Happened?

  • Automatic Joins: When you filter by region, the semantic layer automatically joins orders → customers
  • Consistent Metrics: Revenue is always calculated the same way
  • SQL Rewriting: Your simple SQL gets rewritten to use proper aggregations and joins
Try changing the filters or writing your own queries above! mo.md(%22%22%22%0A%23%23%20What%20Just%20Happened%3F%0A%0A-%20**Automatic%20Joins**%3A%20When%20you%20filter%20by%20region%2C%20the%20semantic%20layer%20automatically%20joins%20orders%20%E2%86%92%20customers%0A-%20**Consistent%20Metrics**%3A%20Revenue%20is%20always%20calculated%20the%20same%20way%0A-%20**SQL%20Rewriting**%3A%20Your%20simple%20SQL%20gets%20rewritten%20to%20use%20proper%20aggregations%20and%20joins%0A%0ATry%20changing%20the%20filters%20or%20writing%20your%20own%20queries%20above!%0A%22%22%22)
